subject: Management
title: When to Compromise
description: A quick, practical guide to When to Compromise.

hook.text: Two teams both wanted the same conference room for recurring meetings. Neither would budge.

buildup.text: Compromise splits the difference. Both sides give up something. Neither is fully satisfied.

discovery.text: Use compromise when time is limited, stakes are moderate, and a fair middle ground exists.

twist.text: Compromise is efficient but can leave both sides feeling like they lost. Don't overuse it.

climax.text: They alternated weeks. Not perfect, but workable. Pragmatism over principle for small stakes.

punchline.text: Compromise is the fast lane when perfection isn't worth the wait.

quiz.question: When is compromise most useful as a conflict style?
options: When time is limited and stakes are moderate
When one side is clearly right and the other is wrong
When the issue is critically important to both parties
